ns2:PrimaryTypeDefinition.ns1:desc: The top-level class in the Common Information Model is Managed Element root Managed Object Class. From this class, all model entities are contained. The Managed Object Class (MOC) has attributes that provide information on the Managed Element Identity, primary location and the products it contains.

ns2:primaryTypeAttribute.ns1:desc: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.
A freetext attribute describing the geographic location of a Managed Element.
A freetext string for additional information to assist Managed Element identification.
Contains product information for the Managed Element and its Managed Functions. This attribute is deprecated.

ns2:primaryTypeAttribute.ns1:lifeCycleDesc: Deprecated at version 2.3. Functionality replaced by TimeM model.
ns2:primaryTypeAttribute.ns1:desc:
Deprecated. This is the local date and time for the Managed Element. The following format is used: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss
The meaning of each field is as follows: YYYY = four digit year MM = two digit month (01=January, etc.) DD = two digit day of month (01 through 31) T = time designator (shows start of time component) hh = two digits of hour (00 through 23, AM/PM not allowed) mm = two digits of minute (00 through 59) ss = two digits of second (00 through 59, leap second not allowed) The hyphen [-] and the colon [:] are used as separators within the date and time of day expressions, respectively.

ns2:primaryTypeAttribute.ns1:lifeCycleDesc: Deprecated at version 2.3. Functionality replaced by TimeM model.
ns2:primaryTypeAttribute.ns1:desc: DEPRECATED. This is the timeZone in which the Managed Element resides. The possible values for this attribute are defined in the public-domain zoneinfo or Olson database. Locations are identified by a string indicating the continent or ocean and then the name of the location, typically the largest city within the region. See http://www.iana.org/time-zones for more information. Example: Europe/Stockholm.

ns2:primaryTypeAttribute.ns1:lifeCycleDesc: Deprecated at version 2.3. Functionality replaced by TimeM model.
ns2:primaryTypeAttribute.ns1:desc: Deprecated. Difference between the value of the localDateTime attribute and UTC.

It provides naming context that allows the managed objects to be partitioned into logical domains. A Distingushed Name (DN) is defined by 3GPP TS 32.300, which splits the DN into a DN Prefix and Local DN, for example DN format: dnPrefix=<DN Prefix>, localDn =<Local DN> Fault Management: dnPrefix does not impact Fault Management, since an NMS recognises a Managed Element by IP address Performance Management (PM): The dnPrefix is present in the PM Data file, Result Output Period (ROP) file, if the dnPrefix attribute is specified, that is, not an empty string. Example: DC=ericsson.se,g3SubNetwork=Sweden Example: DC=ericsson.se,g3SubNetwork=Sweden
The type of product being managed. For example the type could be RBS or CSCF.
The release of the product type specified by the attribute managedElementType. It commonly contains the Managed Element release, for example L12.0, 13A, R1A
Optional identifier for the managed element. Used for legacy Ericsson model compatibility towards some third-party management systems.
Provided for 3GPP alignment. The physical location (e.g. an address) of the Managed element.
Provided for 3GPP alignment. If set, it shall contain 'Ericsson AB'.
Provided for 3GPP alignment. It may hold an Operator-supplied state in free text form.
Provided for 3GPP alignment. The software version of the ManagedElement.
Provided for 3GPP alignment. If set, it should describe a Managed element's functionality or a combination of functionalities.

Replaces the value component of the RDN in the COM Northbound Interface. This attribute shall, if used, be set to a simple string which adheres to 3GPP MO Naming Convention . The value should be unique within the network namespace.
